name: Pork Sweet Potato Stew
author: msanders
summary: Delicious tender pork and sweet potatoes equal a lovely stew! Can be adapted for the slow cooker after the skillet steps.
ingredients: 3 pounds pork loin, cut into 1-inch cubes
3 pounds sweet potatoes, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a large casserole dish or Dutch oven with cooking spray
Combine brown sugar and flour in a bowl
Place Dijon mustard in a separate bowl
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Coat pork cubes with Dijon mustard and toss in brown sugar mixture to coat
Brown coated pork cubes on all sides in hot olive oil, about 3 minutes per side
Transfer browned pork into prepared casserole dish, leaving oil in skillet
Cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot skillet until onions are soft, about 5 minutes
Stir chicken broth, sherry, sweet potato cubes, black pepper, rosemary, thyme, and salt into onion; bring to a boil
Pour sweet potato mixture over pork and cover casserole dish
Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes; uncover and bake until pork is no longer pink inside and sweet potato cubes are tender, about 20 more minutes
